snippet: People who knew Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl in Idaho paint a fairly consistent portrait: hard-working and socially awkward, full of restless energy and romantic plans.
abstract: Military investigators are trying to untangle central mystery of how and why Sgt Bowe Bergdahl disappeared from his remote outpost in eastern Afghanistan in 2009; Bergdahl was subsequently captured and held by the Taliban for five years, until his 2014 release in exchange for five detainees held at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON and MATT FURBER
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
